results.title: VFL on film 1946-1982: Marking time. - Vol. 2
results.creator_credit: Ken Berryman and National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
results.brief_description: This sequel to VFL on film Vol. 1 is another fascinating compilation of documentary and newsreel footage of the premier Australian Rules Competition between the period from post World War II to the advent of the national competition and includes footage of all twelve League teams. It comprises: 1. The Post-War Powers: Essendon’s golden era; success for the Blues and the Cats. 2. Magpie triumphs. 3. The Demon dynasty: the resurgence of Melbourne in the 1950’s and the one that got away. 4. The New Heroes: the stars of the ‘50’s, ‘60’s and ‘70’s; the Brownlow Medal; victories for the Big V. 5. The Drought Breakers: breakthroughs for the “new” VFL teams and for a foundation member. 6. The Dedicated Fans: rituals in the outer from Victoria Park to Glenferrie Oval. 7. The Television Game: how technology transformed the suburban game. 8. The Big League: the end of the local competition era and its film coverage. Includes rare footage not previously released on video and a detailed commentary by Craig Willis.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ken Berryman and National Film and Sound Archive of Australia

results.title: VFL on film 1909-1945: Marking time. - Vol. 1.
results.creator_credit: Ken Berryman and National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
results.brief_description: To commemorate the Centenary of the Australian Football League, the National Film & Sound Archive produced this outstanding compilation of rarely seen documentary and newsreel footage of the early Victorian Football League (VFL) competition. Highlights include the earliest surviving film of a VFL match - the 1909 Grand Final, Carlton vs South Melbourne, action sequences featuring early legends of the game including Dick Lee, Dave McNamara, Billy Busbridge, Syd and Gordon Coventry, Ivor Warne Smith, Bill Mohr, Alan Hopkins, Jack Titus, Bob Pratt, Jack Dyer, Ron Todd, Jack Regan, Haydn Bunton, and rare footage of supporters. Commentary by Tim Lane. Background notes are contained inside the cover.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ken Berryman and National Film and Sound Archive of Australia

results.title: Veteran cars in Australia
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Thompson, Cine Service and H Sleigh
results.brief_description: In 1956 Victoria staged its Annual Veteran Car Rally over a two day period and required cars to journey from Melbourne to Ballarat and back again. Among competing cars was a 1906 Argyle, 1908 Fiat, 1914 Napier and 1914 Standard. A Cadillac built in 1913 was declared the outright winner. The annual rally provided owners of old cars to show the public the steadiness, dependability and elegance of their automobiles. Narrated by Ray Chapman.

results.title: Vesalius, founder of modern anatomy
results.creator_credit: Susan Wheeler, Thomas R. Forbes and Yale University School of Medicine
results.brief_description: Documentary on Andreas Vesalius, born in 1514 in Brussels. Appointed Professor of Anatomy at Padua in 1536, he revolutionised anatomy with clear and succint lectures and dissections of cadavers. In 1543 his seven books on the structure of the human body was published - a comprehensive work which describes bones, muscles, blood vessels, nervous system, abdominal and thoracic viscera and head. The work corrected anatomical myths dating back to Roman times and emphasised the wholistic structure of the body. His use of detailed illustrations and emphasis on dissection and observation paved the way for modern anatomy and physiology.

results.title: Versailles: the palace of the sun
results.brief_description: Presents the man-made beauties of the Palace of Versailles, built for the “Sun-King”, Louis XIV. Shows the famous Hall of Mirrors. Lingers on the many works of sculpture and shows the Trianons, the Queen’s Hamlet, and the great gardens designed by La Notre.

results.title: Versailles
results.brief_description: Beautiful Versailles perpetuates the history of France. This silent film with English intertitles includes a brief look at the 17th century Palace of Versailles, its history and its architecture.

results.title: Verbal communication: the power of words
results.creator_credit: Stephen Judson, Peter Jordan and CRM Productions
results.brief_description: Uses animation, humorous vignettes, and dramatized slices of organizational life to illustrate the four critical parts of every verbal exchange: the speaker, the language used, the atmosphere, and the listener. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.
